solution_line_template: When Kendra bought {num_toys_bought} toys, she paid {num_toys_bought}*${price_toy} = $<<{num_toys_bought}*{price_toy}={cost_toys}>>{cost_toys}
Since the price of a hat is ${price_hat}, when Kendra bought {num_hats_bought} hats, she paid {num_hats_bought}*${price_hat} = $<<{num_hats_bought}*{price_hat}={cost_hats}>>{cost_hats}
The total costs for the hats and wooden toys Kendra bought is ${cost_toys}+${cost_hats} = $<<{cost_toys}+{cost_hats}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
From the ${bill_amount} bill, Kendra received change worth ${bill_amount}-${total_cost} =$<<{bill_amount}-{total_cost}={change_received}>>{change_received}
